Class AeEngineFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.AeEngineFactory
public class AeEngineFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Maintains a singleton instance of the engine.

start

public static void start()
                  throws AeBusinessProcessException
Start the BPEL engine. Should not be called until all of the expected deployments have been completed (as previously persisted processes will assume their resources are available as soon as they start up again).

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

createNewEngine

protected static AeBpelEngine createNewEngine(IAeQueueManager aQueueManager,
                                              IAeProcessManager aProcessManager,
                                              IAeLockManager aLockManager,
                                              IAeAttachmentManager aAttachmentManager)
                                       throws AeException
Creates the new engine instance. This provides a means of changing the underlying engine class based on the config file which is something that we do in order to easily swap in our clustered version of the engine.

Parameters:
aQueueManager -
aProcessManager -
aLockManager -
aAttachmentManager -

initializeTimerManager

protected static void initializeTimerManager()
This method initializes the timer manager used by the engine. We will first attempt to lookup the timer manager from the JNDI location specified in the engine config file. If not specified or unable to load, then we will use default timer manager.

initializePolicyMapper

                                      throws AeException
This method initializes the policy mapper used by the engine.

Throws:
AeException

createQueueManager

protected static IAeQueueManager createQueueManager()
                                             throws AeException
Factory method for creating the queue manager for the engine. The type of manager to use will be determined based on information found in the engine configuration.

Returns:
A queue manager.
Throws:
AeException

createConfigSpecificClass

public static java.lang.Object createConfigSpecificClass(java.util.Map aConfig)
                                                  throws AeException
This method takes a configuration map for a manager and instantiates that manager. This involves some simple java reflection to find the proper constructer and then calling that constructor.

Parameters:
aConfig - The engine configuration map for the manager.
Returns:
An engine manager (alert, queue, etc...).
Throws:
AeException

configured instance of SOAP MessageFactory. If no entry defined in AeEngineConfig or if there is an exception creating the instance, the default for the server is used.
